programme.desc: Frolic about a curvaceous teacher (Virginia Mayo) pursued by a commercial artist (Ronald Reagan). Eddie Bracken, Dona Drake, Henry Travers. Mother: Lois Wilson. Miss Shoemaker: Florence Bates. Graves: Jerome Cowan. Woody: Gary Gray.

programme.title: The Princess and the Pirate
programme.desc: Bob Hope plays a cowardly actor who runs afoul of buccaneers on the Spanish Main. (cc).

programme.title: South Sea Woman
programme.desc: A marine faces a court martial for desertion after he and a fellow soldier endure many adventures while trying to make it from Shanghai to Pearl Harbor before the Japanese attack.

programme.title: The Face Behind the Mask
programme.desc: An accident-scarred immigrant is briefly diverted from crime by the love of a blind girl.

programme.title: Arsenic and Old Lace
programme.desc: Macabre comedy about a pair of sweet old ladies from Brooklyn who put lonely bachelors out of their misery with sips from their arsenic-laced elderberry wine---"acts of mercy" that their visiting nephew finds hard to swallow. The film is based on Joseph Kesselring's Broadway play, a long-running hit that contractually delayed release of the picture almost three years (cc).

programme.title: Silk Stockings
programme.desc: Musical remake of the 1939 comedy "Ninotchka" features a tuneful Cole Porter soundtrack and tells the tale of a stern Russian emissary sent to Paris on business but discovering the pleasures of capitalism and romance with a movie producer.

programme.title: You'll Find Out
programme.desc: Kay Kyser and his orchestra offer a melange of mirth, melody and mayhem in this spoof of "Old House" horror films. Janis: Helen Parrish. Fenninger: Peter Lorre. Mainwaring: Boris Karloff. Margo: Alma Kruger. Saliano: Bela Lugosi. Chuck: Dennis O'Keefe. Ginny Simms: Herself. Harry Babbitt: Himself. Jurgen: Joseph Eggenton. Sully Mason: Himself. Ish Kabibble: Himself. David Butler directed.

programme.title: All Through the Night
programme.desc: Humphrey Bogart plays a New Yorker with underworld connections who battles Nazi saboteurs planning to sink a battleship. Conrad Veidt, Kaaren Verne, Peter Lorre, Jane Darwell, Judith Anderson, Frank McHugh, William Demarest, Barton MacLane, Jackie Gleason, Phil Silvers, Wally Ford. Directed by Vincent Sherman.

programme.title: The Comedy of Terrors
programme.desc: A gathering of some of the genre's greats (Vincent Price, Boris Karloff, Peter Lorre, Basil Rathbone) in a spook-spoof involving the funeral business. Joe E. Brown, Joyce Jameson. Richard Matheson script.

programme.title: Scent of Mystery
programme.desc: A vacationing photographer (Denholm Elliott) stumbles onto a murder plot and hustles through Spain to save the intended victim. Peter Lorre, Beverly Bentley, Paul Lukas. Johnny: Liam Redmond. Tommy: Leo McKern. Fleming: Peter Arne. Winifred: Diana Dors. Margharita: Mary Laura Wood. Also known as "Holiday in Spain." Jack Cardiff directed.

programme.title: M
programme.desc: When 1930s Berlin is terrorized by a serial killer who preys on children, the citizens, the police and the criminal underworld join forces for a manhunt that soon becomes a paranoid frenzy.

programme.title: Crime and Punishment
programme.desc: The arresting Dostoyevsky classic about an arrogant student who is convinced he can get away with murdering a pawnbroker, but winds up being tormented by conscience and pursued by a dogged, methodical lawman.

programme.title: The Mask of Dimitrios
programme.desc: Mystery novelist Cornelius Leyden is on vacation in Istanbul when the body of master criminal Makropoulos washes up on shore. Leyden becomes inspired to learn and tell the story of Makropoulos' rise to power, traveling across Europe to uncover secrets and stitch together the criminal's narrative. Based on the novel "A Coffin for Dimitrios" by Eric Ambler.

programme.title: The Verdict
programme.desc: After a Scotland Yard detective loses his job after a faulty conviction, he must battle his successor after becoming embroiled in a murder investigation, in this "locked room" mystery set in 1890s London.

programme.title: Mad Love
programme.desc: Deranged surgeon, Dr. Gogol, pines for actress Yvonne Orlac who is planning a break from acting to tour with her pianist husband, Stephen. After an accident mangles Stephen's hands, Gogol replaces them with the hands of a dead knife-wielding murderer which appear to have retained the urge to use knives as weapons. Based on the novel "Les Mains D'Orlac" by Maurice Renard.

programme.title: Island of Doomed Men
programme.desc: Peter Lorre in one of his most villainous roles---as a brutal tyrant who rules an empire of ex-cons. Don Beddoe. Sheldon: Robert Wilcox. Lorraine: Rochelle Hudson. Ed: Stanley Brown. Siggy: George E. Stone. Cort: Charles Middleton. Doc: Kenneth McDonald. Directed by Charles Barton.

programme.title: Easy to Love
programme.desc: The star of an aquatic show tries making her boss, the man she loves, notice her by being flirtatious with two other men.

programme.title: The Miracle
programme.desc: A young postulant becomes unsure of her vocation when she falls in love with a soldier in Napoleonic Spain, and leaves the convent when she gets no reassurance from prayer.

programme.title: Giant
programme.desc: Best Picture based on the Edna Ferber bestseller about Texas cattlemen, oil, troubled romances and racial injustice chronicles the lives of one proud family from the 1930s to the '50s. James Dean's final film; George Stevens won a Best Director Oscar.

programme.title: Cheyenne Autumn
programme.desc: John Ford's final Western is an account of the defiant 1887 migration of 300 Cheyenne Indians from their reservation in Oklahoma territory to their original home in Wyoming.

programme.title: The Carpetbaggers
programme.desc: The saga of a ruthless tycoon turned Hollywood mogul and the people who cross his life. George Peppard, Carroll Baker, Bob Cummings, Alan Ladd, Elizabeth Ashley. Jennie: Martha Hyer. McAllister: Lew Ayres. Norman: Martin Balsam. From the Harold Robbins novel. Sprawling, episodic success story. An elaborate, flashy production. Directed by Edward Dmytryk. (cc).

programme.title: Baby Doll
programme.desc: The owner of a successful cotton company is married to a teenager who refuses to have sex with him until she's 20. When the man burns down a rival's business, the enemy tries to claim the wife as his compensation.(n)

programme.title: Bridge to the Sun
programme.desc: An American woman living in Tokyo with her Japanese-diplomat husband during World War II endures not only culture shock and home sickness, but increasing suspicion and discomfort from her husband's government.(n)

programme.title: Sylvia
programme.desc: A wealthy man (Peter Lawford) hires an investigator (George Maharis) to uncover the past of his fiancée (Carroll Baker). Jane: Joanne Dru. Irma: Viveca Lindfors. Oscar: Edmond O'Brien. Jonas: Aldo Ray. Mrs. Argona: Ann Sothern. Bruce: Lloyd Bochner. Gordon Douglas directed.(n)

programme.title: Something Wild
programme.desc: A young woman who was raped attempts to cope with the trauma afterward by running away from her family and seeking shelter with a sweet auto mechanic.(n)

programme.title: Star 80
programme.desc: Eric Roberts dominates Bob Fosse's story of actress-model Dorothy Stratten (Mariel Hemingway). Cliff Robertson, Carroll Baker. Nicholas: Roger Rees. Geb: David Clennon. Detective: Josh Mostel. Eileen: Lisa Gordon.(n)

programme.title: Warlock
programme.desc: A gunman is hired to rid a town of outlaws. Richard Widmark, Henry Fonda, Anthony Quinn. Jessie: Dolores Michaels. Lilly: Dorothy Malone. Edward Dmytryk directed.(n)

programme.title: The Guns of Navarone
programme.desc: During World War II, a crack team of six commandos undertakes a suicide mission to destroy two massive German guns that guard a strategic channel in the Aegean Sea and block Allied passage.(n)

programme.title: The Shoes of the Fisherman
programme.desc: A Russian bishop becomes pope following his release from a Siberian prison, and attempts to prevent a nuclear war while helping the starving Red Chinese.(n)

programme.title: Lust for Life
programme.desc: A dramatization of the life of Vincent van Gogh offers a portrait of the artist as a tormented man whose obsessive devotion to his work engulfs, consumes and finally destroys him. Kirk Douglas (as Vincent) was nominated for Best Actor, and Anthony Quinn won a Supporting Actor Oscar as his painting rival Paul Gauguin, despite a limited amount of screen time.(n)

programme.title: Viva Zapata!
programme.desc: A cradle-to-grave biopic of the Mexican revolutionary Emiliano Zapata that follows him from his upbringing as a peasant to his miltary strikes with Pancho Villa. (cc).(n)

programme.title: A High Wind in Jamaica
programme.desc: Adaptation of Richard Hughes' story "The Innocent Voyage," about children overjoyed to find themselves among pirates' booty. Anthony Quinn, James Coburn. Rosa: Lila Kedrova. Emily: Deborah Baxter. Mathias: Dennis Price. John: Martin Amis. Dutch Captain: Gert Frobe. Rachel: Roberta Tovey. Harry: Henry Beltran. Marpole: Kenneth J. Warren. Alberto: Benito Carruthers. Laura: Karen Flack. Edward: Jeffrey Chandler. Margaret: Viviane Ventura. Directed by Alexander Mackendrick.(n)

programme.title: The Hangover Part II
programme.desc: The gang travel to Thailand to see Stu get married, and lose the groom's future brother-in-law Teddy during the bachelor party. In their search to find him, their previous Las Vegas adventure starts to look like a family trip to Disneyland. (repeat) (cc).

programme.desc: In the third-season premiere, Beckett finds Castle at a murder scene holding a gun and is forced to arrest him despite his claims of innocence. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: An extra body found in a casket during a funeral leads Beckett and Castle to investigate the love affairs of doctors at a local hospital. And Castle's girlfriend tries to bond with Alexis. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: A serial murderer called the Triple Killer strikes again after disappearing four years ago, and Beckett and Castle scramble to catch him before he takes more victims. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: A male stripper dressed as a cop is found murdered after Castle and Beckett respond to an officer-down call, and the probe focuses on the victim's life as a struggling actor. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: Beckett and Castle discover the brutal kidnapping of a boy while investigating the shooting death of a subway worker in Central Park. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The murder of a cop leads to a case involving physical abuse in a relationship between the deceased and his former partner, a divorced mother of two (Jenny Bacon). Jerrold: Philip Bosco. Felton: Holt McCallany. Sandra Felton: Marissa Matrone. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The investigation into the shooting of a newspaper columnist leads to a murder case from two decades earlier. Hampton: Matthew Bennett. Nicole: Marsha Dietlein. Arlene: Elaine Bromka. Franchetta: Frank Vincent. Myra: Caitlin Clarke. Tucci: Bob Dishy. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Piper casts an errant spell that sends Phoebe and Paige back in time and forces them to observe moments that Leo and Piper are sharing with a marriage counselor. programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Three wood nymphs are spotted in San Francisco, but Piper and Paige disagree on how to find the trio, who fled their home after a demon (Jaimz Woolvett) murdered their satyr (Todd Duffey). Meanwhile, Phoebe tries to avoid her boss after spending the night with him. Paige: Rose McGowan. Piper: Holly Marie Combs. Phoebe: Alyssa Milano. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Charmed

Paige: Rose McGowan. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.sub-title: I Know What You Did Last Summer
programme.desc: Sam and Dean search for a young woman who can hear conversations between angels after Ruby tells them a powerful demon is on the prowl to find her. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: Sam and Dean learn why the angels want to kill Anna. They try to save her by helping her restore a crucial part of her past, even as Alastair and his demons close in on her. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: Sam and Dean investigate the appearance of a female ghost in an abandoned house. But their efforts are complicated when a family moves in and the son is kidnapped through the walls. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.sub-title: Criss Angel Is a Douche Bag
programme.desc: A formerly famous magician living in a small town makes a deal to acquire real magical powers and pays a heavy price for it when a murder occurs. Barry Bostwick, John Rubenstein, Richard Libertini. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Hodgins fears that Christopher Pelant is back for revenge after he and Angela are drugged, and a corpse is found in their bed canopy while flower petals are spread around their son's crib. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Daisy's first case since breaking up with Sweets is a doozy: the remains of two bodies, one a female cancer patient, the other her life coach, found at the same burial site. programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Angela goes undercover on the roller-derby circuit after a skater's dismembered body is discovered. Meanwhile, Cam wonders if Booth is having an affair when she sees him having lunch with an unknown woman. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team join forces with the FBI to investigate a plane crash in the bayou that left three sailors dead. Meanwhile, Sonja and Lasalle interview candidates for the open agent position. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Navy Seal candidate who was murdered just before his graduation leads the team to investigate unorthodox training exercises. Meanwhile, Wade asks Pride for advice after her adopted son announces his own plan to join the Navy. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigate a sailor's murder during a motorcycle rally in the city. Elsewhere, Lasalle seeks advice on his personal life from Gregorio. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: In an effort to recapture their youth, three disillusioned, long-out-of-college pals start an off-campus frat house, then run afoul of the dean. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: How to Be Single

programme.title: Laurel Canyon
programme.desc: A hard-partying rock-and-roll record producer opens her posh California digs to her stuffy son and his equally stuffy fiancée. The character study was written and directed by Lisa Cholodenko, who was partially inspired to make the film while listening to Joni Mitchell's landmark "Ladies of the Canyon" album. Actor Alessandro Nivola, who plays Ian, lead singer of an English rock band, does his own vocals. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: From Prada to Nada
programme.desc: Two sisters must give up their lavish lifestyle when their father's death forces them to move to a tight-knit Latino neighborhood in Los Angeles, where they eventually learn the value of family. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Adam
programme.desc: This character study stars Hugh Dancy as Adam, a man living with Asperger's syndrome, who does his best to reach out to his pretty new upstairs neighbor. As Adam attempts to gain control of his social skills, he discovers that with a little patience and understanding, developing a meaningful relationship might not be as hard as he previously thought. Peter Gallagher, Amy Irving, Rose Byrne. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: Segments include traveling to Mt. Everest to meet the Sherpas of Nepal; an exploration into objectification of women in sports; and an interview with former tennis player Mansour Bahrami, also known as the Court Jester. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Murder on the Orient Express
programme.desc: In 1930s Europe, legendary detective Hercule Poirot probes a murder that occurs aboard the Orient Express. As the thirteen passengers grow paranoid that the killer will strike again, Poirot realizes there's more to the case than meets the eye. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Kiss Kiss Bang Bang
programme.desc: A struggling actor and crook moves to Los Angeles, hoping to score some movie roles, where he meets a gay PI at a party. When a series of female bodies turn up, they find themselves investigating the murders. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Silence of the Lambs
programme.desc: Best Picture winner about an FBI trainee (Best Actress Jodie Foster), who has a knack for analyzing serial killers, and enlists the aid of an imprisoned, cannibalistic sociopath (Best Actor Anthony Hopkins) in tracking a sadistic murderer. An Oscar went to director Jonathan Demme and also Ted Tally won for Best Adapted Screenplay for his script based on the Thomas Harris novel. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Identity
programme.desc: On a dark and stormy night, ten strangers are stranded at an isolated motel in the Nevada desert, only to learn each of them has a secret, and that their arrival at the motel has not been a matter of mere chance. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Snowman
programme.desc: Norwegian police detective Harry Hole hunts a terrifying adversary known as "the Snowman Killer." Hole and a rookie cop investigate cold cases in the hope of nabbing the killer, but they soon resort to more-desperate measures to catch their prey. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Murder by Numbers
programme.desc: Two young boys execute the "perfect" murder, even pinning it on a local crook, but a detective with a disturbed past will not be outsmarted. The boys lie about knowing each other and cover their tracks, but a lack of trust could bring them down. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Lara Croft Tomb Raider The Cradle of Life
programme.desc: The feisty video-game heroine goes against an evil scientist who specializes in biological weapons as they both race to find Pandora's Box. (cc).

programme.title: Słoiki
programme.desc: Prawdzie historie ludzi, którzy przyjechali do Warszawy, by odmienić swoje życie. Mieszkańcy niewielkich miast i wsi liczą, że w stolicy uda im się zrealizować marzenia o lepszej pracy i pieniądzach. Nie łatwo jest im jednak odnaleźć się w wielkomiejskiej rzeczywistości.

programme.title: Dzień dobry

programme.title: Eska On The Beach
programme.desc: Wakacyjny program Eski TV nadawany prosto z najpiękniejszych plaż. Ola Kot zaprezentuje widzom wiele ciekawostek, a wśród nich najnowsze plotki, porady modowe oraz wieści muzyczne z kraju i ze świata. Nie zabraknie najnowszych piosenek i teledysków. Widzowie przekonają się, który utwór zasłuży sobie na miano hitu lata.

programme.title: Hity na czasie
programme.desc: Zestawienie najpopularniejszych utworów muzycznych i teledysków, które znajdują się na szczytach różnych list przebojów.

programme.title: Projekt Kamper
programme.desc: Filip Rudanacja zamienia swojego garbusa na atrakcyjnego kampera i wyrusza na wakacyjną wyprawę. Prowadzący oddaje się paradzie letnich wyzwań. Wypoczywa, szuka dobrej zabawy przy dźwiękach najlepszej muzyki i robi rzeczy, które każdy powinien wykonać podczas urlopu, jak zjedzenie gofra, czy rozstawienie parawanu.

programme.title: Eska On The Beach
programme.desc: Wakacyjny program Eski TV nadawany prosto z najpiękniejszych plaż. Ola Kot zaprezentuje widzom wiele ciekawostek, a wśród nich najnowsze plotki, porady modowe oraz wieści muzyczne z kraju i ze świata. Nie zabraknie najnowszych piosenek i teledysków. Widzowie przekonają się, który utwór zasłuży sobie na miano hitu lata.

programme.title: Słoiki
programme.desc: Prawdzie historie ludzi, którzy przyjechali do Warszawy, by odmienić swoje życie. Mieszkańcy niewielkich miast i wsi liczą, że w stolicy uda im się zrealizować marzenia o lepszej pracy i pieniądzach. Nie łatwo jest im jednak odnaleźć się w wielkomiejskiej rzeczywistości.

programme.title: Eska Summer City news
programme.desc: Twórcy programu odwiedzają miejsca, w których odbywają się najciekawsze wakacyjne wydarzenia. Zawitają zarówno do największych polskich miast, jak i mniejszych ośrodków. Pojawią się na imprezach plenerowych, w klubach, na plażach, basenach, aquaparkach czy zawodach sportowych. Prowadzący zapytają napotkane tam osoby o to, jak spędzają lato i gdzie wypoczywają. Nie zabraknie rozmów z gwiazdami i gości specjalnych.

programme.title: Eska Summer City news
programme.desc: Twórcy programu odwiedzają miejsca, w których odbywają się najciekawsze wakacyjne wydarzenia. Zawitają zarówno do największych polskich miast, jak i mniejszych ośrodków. Pojawią się na imprezach plenerowych, w klubach, na plażach, basenach, aquaparkach czy zawodach sportowych. Prowadzący zapytają napotkane tam osoby o to, jak spędzają lato i gdzie wypoczywają. Nie zabraknie rozmów z gwiazdami i gości specjalnych.(n)

programme.desc: Wakacyjny program Eski TV nadawany prosto z najpiękniejszych plaż. programme.title: Projekt Kamper
programme.desc: Filip Rudanacja zamienia swojego garbusa na atrakcyjnego kampera i wyrusza na wakacyjną wyprawę. Prowadzący oddaje się paradzie letnich wyzwań. Wypoczywa, szuka dobrej zabawy przy dźwiękach najlepszej muzyki i robi rzeczy, które każdy powinien wykonać podczas urlopu, jak zjedzenie gofra, czy rozstawienie parawanu.(n)

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: SpongeBob and his pals enter Bikini Bottom's worm-sled race to the South Pole. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Legally Blonde
programme.desc: Ditzy blonde decides to attend Harvard Law School when her snobby boyfriend dumps her for a more "appropriate" woman. Despite her penchant for malls, makeup, and tanning, she shows the elite Ivy League set a thing or two about class and self-confidence. (cc).

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Joey endures a draining audition at the hands of a pompous actor-director (Jeff Goldblum); Ross and Phoebe discover a secret link after being mugged together on the street; and Chandler's advertising internship gets off to an impressive---and depressing---start. Jordan: Teck Holmes. Lowell: Kyle Gass. Steve: Phill Lewis. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Boob Job
programme.desc: Mike (Paul Rudd) and Phoebe decide to live together, and she's thinking that it could be only the beginning. "Load up the Volvo," she says to Ross. "I want to be a soccer mom!" Meanwhile, Chandler and Monica are having money woes, so each goes to Joey to borrow money (without the other knowing, of course). And now that Emma's crawling, Rachel decides that it's time to baby-proof her apartment. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Memorial Service
programme.desc: Chandler's jokey entry on his and Ross's college Web site leads to a faux burial service for the allegedly dead---and obviously unpopular---Geller; Joey refuses to give Emma his favorite stuffed animal; Phoebe begs Monica to help her avoid a post-breakup tryst with Mike (Paul Rudd). Tom: Ernie Grunwald. Kori: Ivana Milicevic. Ross: David Schwimmer. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Overcome with lottery fever, the gang buys up a block of tickets, causing a division over the division of the potential Powerball winnings. Meanwhile, Chandler learns the fate of his internship at the ad agency. Steve: Phill Lewis. Phoebe: Lisa Kudrow. (repeat).

programme.title: Mom
programme.sub-title: Dropped Soap and a Big Guy on a Throne

And in Jordan, Hamza, who's eight, has a day out in town with his dad, and buys a lovely present for his baby sister, Mimi. programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
